Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; white slip on exterior, glazed streaky black (fired reddish) with two faded added white bands near bottom of foot; reserved edge of foot; trace of white slip on underside of foot; inscriptions on interior and exterior.
Curator's comments: The foot of some Mature Animal Style chalices is decorated with concentric added white bands. for parallels, see Lemos nos. 674 and 676 from Pitane. The foot of some Grand Style chalices is decorated with concentric white bands. For parallels, see Lemos no. 800 from Pitane. For parallels regarding Chalice Style chalices with painted bands around the foot, see Lemos no. 938 from Tarentum, no. 952 from Thessaloniki and no. 956 from Istros. The number 384 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 50)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0689) (phase 2)
